info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 5 at 11:31AM CDT until July 5 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
FFWEWX
The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has extended the
* Flash Flood Warning for... Burnet County in south central Texas... Northwestern Travis County in south central Texas... Northwestern Williamson County in south central Texas...
* Until 200 PM CDT.
* At 1131 AM CDT, Automated rain gauges and area Cocorahs reported between 6 and 14 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Much of Burnet County and western Parts of Williamson and Travis County. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Burnet, Marble Falls, Kingsland, Bertram, Buchanan Dam, Leander, Lago Vista, Granite Shoals, Horseshoe Bay, Meadowlakes, Liberty Hill, Buchanan Lake Village, Highland Haven, Shady Grove, Oatmeal, Joppa, Lake Victor, Sunnylane, Watson and Mahomet.
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR MUCH OF BURNET COUNTY AND WESTERN PARTS OF WILLIAMSON AND TRAVIS COUNTY
NWS: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY this area til 2:00 PM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY is in effect for this area until 2:00 PM CDT. This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

area.areaDesc: Burnet, TX; Travis, TX; Williamson, TX

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR MUCH OF BURNET COUNTY AND WESTERN PARTS OF WILLIAMSON AND TRAVIS COUNTY
SNM: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 2:00 PM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 2:00 PM CDT. Esta es una situacion extremadamente peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
